summary: The Police were an English rock band formed in 1977 with members Sting, Andy Summers, and Stewart Copeland. They became very popular from the late 1970s to mid-1980s, blending rock, punk, reggae, and jazz. Their albums, like "Reggatta de Blanc" and "Synchronicity," reached number one in many countries, with hits like "Every Breath You Take." The band broke up in 1986 but reunited in 2007 for a successful world tour. They've sold over 75 million records and won many awards, including six Grammys. They were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2003.
title: The Police
